awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  A Walsh Associative Memory Based      Adaptive Controller for Robot Manipulators
awd_abstract_narration: The main objective of this research is to explore the development of an         intelligent memory that can be trained to remember the previous control         commands for various trajectories of a robot manipulator.  In contrast          to the conventional analytical approach, this technique will provide a          real-time, learning, and adaptive control which does not require any            accurate models of the system.  In initial work, a simple                       three-degree-of-freedom manipulator resembling the Stanford arm was             used as a model to generate a thousand quantified trajectory points for         a training set, and a simple averaging interpolation formula was used           to estimate joint commands for other trajectories.  A hierarchical              (tree) structure was explored for storing the configuration space joint         data for the training set.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
